b: ^You steel yourself and throw open the door to the projection booth. As you feared, you've found

^The moment you see the corpse, you nearly retch. Which is peculiar. Sure, it's a dead body, but you're not a rookie. You've seen worse in a city riddled with vice. But you can't deny the visceral reaction you have, the repulsion.
^You steel yourself and throw open the door to the projection booth. Empty. Your search continues.
^That's two pieces of evidence now that have made your hair stand on end.

^The sudden death, the bizarre house? There's no denying it: this is unlike any other case you've solved before. Whatever happened in this mansion wasn't just sinister. It was surreal. Maybe even supernatural.
^You've seen ugly murder cases before, but they didn't turn your stomach like this. Something else is going on, even if you don't understand what.
^ The only question left, the last fact you can arm yourself with, is determining who perpetrated this act. You'd better hurry and make your accusation.
^You have a bad feeling about this case. There's definitely something strange at play, something bad in the air. You don't have a clue yet what it is,
^You can't put your finger on it, but there's something odd about this case. Something strange in the air. You want to dismiss the idea out of hand,
^ but you've learned to trust your gut. And your gut is saying to stay sharp and watch your back. Maybe if you have another concrete fact, like the murder weapon, you'll better understand the truth.
